Book.Body:
Hello!
Search
This chapter is based entirely around of Search method, which provides a way of searching permutation groups, and finding the group (or coset, or single permutation) which occurs in the intersection of a series of groups. Search is a generic method which can be used to replace a number of GAP methods, including Intersection, Stabilizer, and a variety of other methods. See the Examples section at the end of this chapter.
Search Methods <#Include Label="ConStabilize">
Search Examples
gap> G := Group((1,2),(3,4),(1,3)(2,4));; gap> H := Group((1,2,3),(1,2));; gap> # Find the intersection of G and H gap> Solve([ConInGroup(G), ConInGroup(H)]); [ (), (1,2) ] gap> # Find the set stabilizer of [1,2] in G gap> Solve([ConInGroup(G), ConStabilize([1,2], OnSets)]); [ (), (1,2), (3,4) ]
